algorithm_technique: Backtracking with bitmasking: explore paths, marking visited cells and counting valid paths that cover all empty cells.
problem_summary_simple: Find paths that visit every empty square exactly once, starting and ending at specific points.
problem_summary_technical: Backtracking with bitmasking to explore all valid paths, ensuring each non-obstacle cell is visited exactly once.
key_insights: This problem requires exploring all possible paths, making backtracking a suitable approach.
A bitmask is used to efficiently track visited empty cells.
The state in the DP/memoization includes the current cell and the bitmask of remaining cells to visit.
